meanings.definition: To cross in or into one another
meanings.sent1: The roads incrosses at the busy intersection.
meanings.sent2: The vines incrosses as they grow along the fence.
meanings.sent3: The dance floor was a chaos of incrossing feet.
meanings.sent4: Their destinies incrossed at a fateful moment.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces incrossed perfectly to reveal the hidden image.

meanings.definition: To intersect or cross each other
meanings.sent1: The hiking trails incrosses in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The power lines incrosses above the street.
meanings.sent3: The paths of the two characters incrossed unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Their interests incrossed at the art exhibition.
meanings.sent5: The skaters incrossed gracefully on the ice rink.

meanings.definition: A crossing or intersection of lines or paths
meanings.sent1: The map showed the incrosses of the highways.
meanings.sent2: The city's layout had many incrosses of streets.
meanings.sent3: The painting depicted a beautiful scene of nature's incrosses.
meanings.sent4: The architect designed a stunning building with unique incrosses.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle challenge was to find the hidden incrosses of colors.
